You give a dinner party at your apartment. More people showed up than you expected. Your neighbor, who just arrived, approaches you and asks: Do you have a spare chair I could borrow? You do not, in fact, have a spare chair, but you do have the following items: a broom, a TV armchair, a stool, a ladder and a kitchen table. So you say: No, I don't have a spare chair, but you can have the stool.

inputs:
You give a dinner party at your apartment. More people showed up than you expected. Your neighbor, who just arrived, approaches you and asks: Do you have a spare chair I could borrow? You do not, in fact, have a spare chair, but you do have the following items: a broom, a TV armchair, a stool, a ladder and a kitchen table. So you say: No, I don't have a spare chair, but you can have the stool.

Your turn.
You have been very busy over the last days and didn’t have time to get groceries. Therefore, you got take out for lunch and ran into a friend at the restaurant where you were getting food. You invited them to eat at your house. You just finished eating and you are making coffee now. In your pantry you have sweetener tablets, honey, agave syrup, and salt. Your friend asks: Do you have sugar?
predictions:
To say that you don't have sugar would be to answer the same question in a more direct way, but you could also respond by saying, "No, but you can have honey or agave syrup instead. They're just as sweet."

You do not, in fact, have a spare chair, but you do have the following items: a broom, a TV armchair, a stool, a ladder and a kitchen table. So you say: No, I don't have a spare chair, but you can have the stool.

inputs:
You give a dinner party at your apartment. More people showed up than you expected. Your neighbor, who just arrived, approaches you and asks: Do you have a spare chair I could borrow? You do not, in fact, have a spare chair, but you do have the following items: a broom, a TV armchair, a stool, a ladder and a kitchen table. So you say: No, I don't have a spare chair, but you can have the stool.

Your turn.
You are about to go for a longer walk with some friends. It is a hot day outside. Someone forgot to bring a bottle of water. In your car trunk, you happen to have a to-go mug, a glass, a watering can, and a spoon. They ask: Do you have a bottle?
predictions: You can use all of these objects (except the spoon), so you can adapt it to their request. What do you give to your friend?
